Posts.Content: Dear Everyone, not sure if this has been discussed previously, but i can't seem to find the same thread here. So.. Last year, around june/july, my dad was diagnosed with prostate cancer, Metastatic (M1) and Gleason Score of 10 and PSA 20. I believe that's the fastest growing kind of cancer. Having been struggled with Peeing problem.. On November 2012, he got green light laser treatment, then Vasectomy on following month and radiotherapy the next month. He has been taking 50mg Casodex treatment. Life was enjoyable for him, no pee problem, no buttock soreness, until last week, the PSA tests shown that the PSA suddenly increased to 9 (it was around 0-1 for the last 6 months). And just in a week, my dad starts feeling the buttock soreness and pain. We came back to doctor and USG scan showed that the Prostate has been growing again and he suggested my dad to increase the Casodex dose into 150mg. My dad situation is worrying me so much, he doesnt feel at ease with his buttock soreness and pain. I have several question: 1. Is my dad on the right track of treatment? are there any better solution? 2. How to kill his buttock soreness and pain, i know radiation theraphy can reduce the pain, but my dad has done it before, can it be redone to get the same curing effect? 3. Life expectancy.. i hate to ask this question and learn the answer, but my curiosity kicks in. WebMD says that one third patient with metastatic cancer will survive for 5 years.. what do you say? 4. What should i do next when 150mg casodex no longer retain PSA level? thanks! highly appreciate all the answer
Posts.Title: Increasing PSA after surgery and hormone theraphy

Posts.Content: Hi Fairwind and lancepeace, thank you sooo much for all the support and reply My dad had that castration (what i meant by vasectomy) 7 months ago. While also taking casodex 50mg everyday, his PSA level was kept below 1 until last week, the blood test discover that his PSA raised to 9, the month before, his PSA was 1. (is it supposed to be that fast?). The result freaked me out as i read that castration can keep PSA level and cancer growth for 2 years. Now the doctor suggested my dad to take 150mg casodex. i've checked zytiga and provenge, both are very expensive. Although my dad can afford it, i'm sure he'd rather die for something that expensive (though i'll always make sure he got the best treatment possible) My dad drink juice of mangosteen and boiled tomato (for its lycopene) in regular basis. I know that pomegranade generally increase immune system and my dad's diet has always contain food rich in ip6. it's known that doctor at my country aren't that good (some people die due to malpractice ), but even if i bring my dad to singapore, the treatment will probably the same. regarding the pain, my dad had that spot radiation theraphy 7 months ago, is it safe/wise to do it again? doctor doesn't tell anything about it. just to sum up if i miss any step of treatment on typical metastatic prostate cancer: 1. Hormone Therapy 2. Castration 3. more hormone theraphy, if it fails 4. Chemotheraphy, if it fails 5. xtandi, zytiga, provenge and etc.. yet if it fails 6. what next? thanks!
Posts.Title: Increasing PSA after surgery and hormone theraphy

Posts.Content: Hi Fairwind and lancepeace, thank you so much for the support my father had that castration (what i meant by vasectomy) about 7 months ago, and PSA level has been less than 1 (the doctor still suggested to take casodex), until last week his PSA raised to 9 (is it supposed to be that fast, after castration?). Now he's taking casodex 150mg. my dad had the radiation treatment as well that 7 month ago, and the pain was pretty much gone, but then the PSA raised and he feels it again now. Would it be possible / wise to do the radiation treatment again? the doctor doesn't seem to suggest it. what is the best practice in this case? i read that Opiate can cause urinary retention As for food supplement, right now Dad is drinking juice of mangosteen and juice of boiled tomato for its lycophene. I know that pomegranate is good generally for body immune, i'll definitely let Dad drink it . and also more food that rich in IP6. thanks for the suggestion. what i'm super freaked out right now is.. my dad's cancer grows super fast even after having castration (which other source says that castration will keep psa down for 2 years). Zytiga and provenge are very expensive. Although my dad can definitely afford it, but i believe he won't, not for that much of money. without being too pessimistic, I guess it'd be miracle if my dad lives till next 5 years huh? anw, except the buttock pain problem, he looks and acts normal. Luckily, he still got big appetite on pretty much any kind of food .
Posts.Title: Increasing PSA after surgery and hormone theraphy

Posts.Content: Hi Lancepeace! thank you for your reply me and dad lives at Indonesia. So far the doctor only recommends Casodex 150mg. but i have been reading and researching at google, that once casodex and all hormone theraphy failed (the cancer become castration-resistant), comes chemotherapy. When chemo fails, comes zytiga. When zytiga fails.. there pretty much everything right? any idea on reduce pain on the buttocks?

Posts.Title: Increasing PSA after surgery and hormone theraphy

Posts.Content: HighlanderCFH, Basically, Green Light laser is a better way to treat prostate enlargement compare to TURP anw, my dad stats as follow: 1. Metastatic Prostate Cancer (M1) 2. Gleason Score of 10 3. Cancer detected (too late) about a year ago, PSA was 20 4. He had castration surgery 8 months ago 5. recently his PSA raise to 9 6. He is now taking Casodex 150mg daily
Posts.Title: How often Green Light surgery can be performed?

Posts.Content: Dear All, about 8 months ago, my dad had green light surgery (an alternative to TURP) to scrap some cancer that grew pressing his urethra, making it difficult for him to pee normally. since then, he pee normally and the flow is rapid. but since last two weeks, his urinating frequency increase significantly, the rapid is slower, often there are pain while peeing. Doctor said that Dad's cancer starts growing again and it presses the uretra. My question, is it safe to do the green light surgery again? how often it can be done?
Posts.Title: How often Green Light surgery can be performed?

Posts.Content: Hi Presence80, i'm sorry to hear about your dad condition. I know some day my dad will probably face the same pain as your dad. Cheer him up. i'm praying for my dad as well your dad and anyone who suffer from prostate cancer. may god gives strength to us all
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer that has metastasized

Posts.Content: Hi Presence80, i'm sorry to hear about your dad condition. I know some day my dad will probably face the same pain as your dad. Cheer him up. i'm praying for my dad as well your dad and anyone who suffer from prostate cancer. may god gives strength to us all
